file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-08-04 - TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the toilet-unit drain valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 38-32-08-000-801-A TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - REMOVAL TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - INSTALLA- ALL 38-32-08-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 38-32-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - REMOVAL A. General WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. LAVATORY FLUIDS ARE CONTAMINATED AND CORROSIVE: • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY GLOVES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the toilet-unit drain valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes To prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the toilet unit is serviced (AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300) and empty. (2) On the overhead circuit-breaker panel, open the FLUSH circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 1/LAVATORY/FLUSH) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (3) Remove the toilet shroud ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). (4) Put the canvas around the toilet to prevent spillage on the floor and as a protection for the lavatory. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Loosen the nut (6) from the drain-cable roll pin (5) and move apart the upper section of the toilet-unit drain cable (4) and the lower section of the toilet-unit drain cable (7). (2) Loosen the nut (2) and the washer (1) to remove the toilet-unit drain valve (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Toilet-Unit Drain Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 262 B 3. DRAIN VALVE 2. NUT 1. WASHER DET A 4. TOILET-UNIT DRAIN-CABLE UPPER SECTION 5. DRAIN CABLE ROLL PIN 6. NUT VIEW B 7. TOILET-UNIT DRAIN-CABLE LOWER SECTION EM145AMM380385B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-08 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. TOILET-UNIT DRAIN VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. LAVATORY FLUIDS ARE CONTAMINATED AND CORROSIVE: • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY GLOVES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) This task gives the procedures to install the toilet-unit drain valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes To prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 38-32-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the toilet unit drain valve (3) and attaches it with the nut (2) and washer (1). (2) Install the nut (6) to the drain-cable roll pin (5) to connect the upper section (4) of the toilet-unit drain cable to the lower section (7) of the toilet-unit drain cable. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the overhead circuit-breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the FLUSH circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 1/LAVATORY/FLUSH) and close it. (2) Install the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400). (3) Service the toilet unit (AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300). (4) Remove the canvas from around the toilet unit. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 38-32-08 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
